main.name: Andrei Grovu
main.description: I've created this website as a fun project for you to get to know me better.
main.bio: I'm currently a 2nd year in Systems Design Engineering at the University of Waterloo. As a student I'm currently exploring multiple technologies looking for a niche where I can apply and develop my skills. I have a passion for building and exploring creative solutions in software that can bring value to people's lives.
main.contactmessage: Below please feel free to reach out and send me a message with any questions, thank you...  *note: The submit form is currently down, for any inquiries email me at: agrovu@gmail.com

resume.skillmessage: Here is how I would classify my current skill profile:

education.description: Notable courses: Digital Computation (C++), Data Structures and Algorithms (C++), Intro to Design (SolidWorks/AutoCAD), Digital Systems, Human Factors in Design.
Completed the IB Diplmona Program with Honours.

work.title: Junior Systems Analyst
work.description: Lead the transfer credit project in the systems department at the University of Waterloo. Created a python application using selenium webdrivers to automate the movement of transfer credit data from a CRM database into the school website. Developed this application to run on multiple virtual machines to increase effeciency of automated entry. Created documentation for the application and it is currently used as a tool by employees to move new transfer data as it is created.

work.title: QA Analyst
work.description: Converted all manual testing workflows into automated python scripts. Implemented these scripts into a Jenkins pipeline, so they would run upon new software releases and produce a success log of all base functionality. Enhanced the efficiency of QA sprints on new software releases by 70% through automation of manual QA processes. Resolved front-end bugs in React and reported solutions through JIRA.

projects.title: IN PROGRESS
projects.category: More projects coming soon, stay tuned!

testimonials.text: Andrei has made a significant, positive impact on moving the Registrar's Office Transfer Credit Project forward. When he first arrived he assessed our needs and quickly had a first script running and successfully did a load into a small simple table.  After that he was off and running!  As the work progressed to more complex loads, he has significantly improved his Python coding skills and coding efficiency. His work provides us new functionality for automated entries and error logging that provides enough information to help resolve any errors with the load. The Selenium library he is leaving us with will save hundreds of hours of manual coding. Given the unusual circumstances of this work term, it is a blessing that Andrei is such a strong, self-directed learner as he has been able to continue working from home and making great progress.

Andrei's performance has been exemplary. He has taken a leadership role and has gone beyond expectations set for prior to joining our team. He has acknowledged what has been expected of him for his term and has delivered his work on time. Andrei asks valuable questions and makes the extra effort to understand the overall functionality of our application and ways in which we can improve our user experience. His work this term will also greatly increase the overall effeciency of our QA process.
